page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY cont'd
page.content: {THE CASTLE}was built around 1560 by the Earl of Cassilis as his town residence. In the traditional Scottish baronial style it had a square tower with round turrets and extended across the modern main street_the finest of the 28 lairds' houses described in 1686 by the writer Abercrummie. A lovely little oriel window overlooks the high street from the room in which one of the countesses was imprisoned after running off with the gypsy chief Johnny Faa_according to romantic local legend. {THE OLD COLLEGE}was built on the site of the parish church of St. Cuthbert granted to the Cistercian nunnery of N.Berwick by Earl Duncan in 1216. The more recent building dates from 1371 as a chapel and from 1441 as a Collegiate church.
